description: This Conversation provides answers to questions about the Voice Gateway for Watson. It contains multiple language support.

values: it was great to talk to you about the voice gateway! Goodbye
It was a pleasure talking to you. Talk to you later

The Watson services used with the voice gateway are the watson speech to text service, the watson text to speech service, the watson conversation service, and the watson retrieve and rank service. Would you like more details on how I use these services? ...

The Voice Gateway uses 4 main Watson services. First, Watson STT ... Speech to Text service. Second, Watson TTS ... Text to Speech service. Third, the Watson conversation service. Lastly, the watson retrieve and rank service. Would you like more details on how I use these services? ...
Hi this is Lisa! How can I help? ...
Hello, this is Lisa speaking. What would you like to know? ...
Hi this is Mike! How can I help?
Hello, this is Mike speaking. What would you like to know? ...

dialog_nodes.title: end call

values: Hope this call was of help to you. May I end the call?
Hope I was of help. Should I disconnect our call  now? ...

dialog_nodes.previous_sibling: would you like to know more

values: The Voice Gateway supports two broad use cases. The first is a self-service agent which can interact directly with a caller using natural language. Self-service agents are built with the Watson Conversation service. The voice gateway can also act as a more passive agent assistant. In this mode the voice gateway can listen in on a conversation between a caller and agent, producing a real-time transcription of the phone call which can be used to provide useful feedback to the agent in real-time. Would you like to know more about the self service agent, the agent assistant capability, or both?

The Voice Gateway is architected as two independently scalable micro services. To be able to deploy these two micro services you need a Docker environment such as Coo bur net ees or IBM Spectrum conductor for containers. This can either be on premises or in a cloud of your choosing. Note that although the voice gateway can be run in either location, the Watson services which it communicates with are only available in the cloud in IBM Bluemix. Would you like to know more?

The voice gateway charges for the number of call minutes it processes. The list price is 5 cents per minute, and you can purchase entitlement in multiples of one thousand minutes on a monthly basis. Would you like to know more about the voice gateway?
Diga Português para continuar em Português ...
Diga Español para seguir en Español ...
This conversation has around 20 different questions, with information on several areas such as use cases, security, contacts, price, documentation, capacity, etc. What would you like to know?

This demo conversation has around 20 diferent questions about the IBM Voice Gateway, with information on multiple areas such as use cases, security, contacts, price, documentation, capacity, running environment, etc. What would you like to know?

dialog_nodes.title: Running locations

values: The voice gateway can run either on premises or in the cloud. Would you like more details about the environment the voice gateway needs to run in?

dialog_nodes.previous_sibling: What else is needed to make the voice gateway run

values: There's a lot of options when it comes to security and the voice gateway. When installed on premise, the voice gateway uses SSL for all connections out to Watson cloud services. The gateway can tunnel through a forwarding proxy or it can connect using an MPLS circuit using mutual authentication. Please refer to the documentation for details on how to configure security for the voice gateway. Do you have any more questions about the voice gateway?

There are multiple alternatives to configure security for the voice gateway. When installed on premise, the voice gateway uses SSL for all connections out to Watson cloud services. The voce gateway can tunnel through a forwarding proxy or it can connect using an MPLS circuit using mutual authentication. Please refer to the voice gateway documentation available on the internet for details on how to configure security. Do you have any more questions about the voice gateway?
OK. What else would you like to know about the IBM Voice Gateway? ...
Agora posso entender Português. Está seguro que quer continuar em Português? ...
Ahora puedo interpretar Español. ¿Está seguro que quiere cambiar a Español? ...

values: I use the watson speech to text service to transcribe what you are saying, and the text to speech service to speak back to you. The conversation service is fed the transcript of what you are saying, and by using a combination of natural language processing, and rules which guide me to the correct responses, I am able to find an appropriate response for your questions. The retrieve and rank service is used when I am in agent assist mode, and is used to ensure that the information I send to a call center agent is the most relevant information for the current conversation ...

dialog_nodes.title: capacityquestion

values: The voice gateway can handle multiple calls at the same time. The limit to what it can handle is based on the number of CPU cores it is running on - we average 30 simultaneous calls per CPU core ...

The Voice Gateway capacity is mainly defined by the number of simultaneuos calls that the solution will need to process. Currently, the Voice Gateway can handle an average of 30 concurrent calls per each CPU core. As an example, a typical 8-core system could handle up to 240 simulataneous calls ...

dialog_nodes.title: What else is needed to make the voice gateway run

values: In addition to the voice gateway itself you will also need a Docker environment in which to deploy the voice gateway, as well as the Watson speech to text, Watson text to speech, Watson conversation, and Watson retrieve and rank services in Bluemix

dialog_nodes.dialog_node: What else is needed to make the voice gateway run

go_to.dialog_node: would you like to know more

values: IBM Bluemix is IBM's cloud platform, which runs a variety of different services and application frameworks. You can easily add these services to other services and applications, to build powerful solutions ...

IBM Bluemix is the Cloud platform from IBM. It offers many different services and frameworks on a pay-as-you-go basis, which can be combined into powerful applications such as this natural language information system you are accessing now ...

go_to.dialog_node: would you like to know more

values: Docker is a virtualization technology which allows you to deploy, manage, and scale applications and services quickly an easily. Coo bur net ees is a variant of Docker which brings some additional capabilities. The voice gateway is designed to be deployed in these environments to make it easy to deploy and manage ...

go_to.dialog_node: would you like to know more

values: The documentation for the voice gateway is available online on the IBM Knowledge Center. You can find it by searching for the keywords ... IBM Voice Gateway documentation ...
The documentation is readily available on the internet. You can find it by searching the key words ... IBM Voice Gateway Knowledge Center ...

dialog_nodes.title: Where are you running right now

values: The Voice Gateway you are talking through is currently based in IBM Bluemix, more specifically the Dallas datacenter. The Watson services are also running in this datacenter ...
This demo, which is based on the IBM Voice Gateway accessing Watson services, is currently running on the IBM Bluemix datacenter in Dallas, Texas ...

dialog_nodes.dialog_node: Where are you running right now

go_to.dialog_node: would you like to know more

values: The entire solution is created using a combination of IBM Watson services, as well as the IBM Voice Gateway. The Voice Gateway component was developed by the WebSphere Application Server team, as it is built on top of WebSphere Liberty's powerful SIP capabilities ...

This solution demo was developed using the IBM Watson services on Bluemix combined with the IBM Voice Gateway, which allows a caller to talk to Watson over the phone. The Voice Gateway component was created by the WebSphere Application Server team, as it is built on top of WebSphere Liberty's powerful SIP ... Session Initiation Protocol capabilities ...

When acting as an agent assistant, media can be forked out to Watson using a protocol called SIPREC. In this mode Watson uses Speech To Text to transcribe both the caller and agent streams in real time. The transcription can then be analyzed with other Watson services such as Natural Language Classification and Rank and Retrieve to provide real time insights that the agent can then use to help quickly answer the callers question. Do you have any more questions about the voice gateway?

When acting as an agent assistant, media can be forked out to Watson using a protocol called SIPREC. In this mode Watson uses Speech To Text to transcribe both the caller and agent streams in real time. The transcription can then be analyzed with other Watson services such as Natural Language Classification and Rank and Retrieve to provide real time insights that the agent can then use to help quickly answer the callers question. When acting as a self service agent, callers can call Watson directly from their telephone and ask Watson questions using natural language. Do you have any more questions about the voice gateway?
When acting as a self service agent, callers can call Watson directly from their telephone and ask Watson questions using natural language. Do you have any more questions about the voice gateway?

I can answer many different questions - the limits on this are being able to determine the difference between similar questions, and the amount of time spent building my conversation service to support multiple questions. This demo conversation has around 20 different questions that I can understand and answer, in addition to offering additional details on various subjects, such as use-cases, price, documentation, security, running environment, capacity, contacts, etc ...

The information I can provide is only limited by how much I am taught during the learning process and the artificial intelligence techniques employed in discerning the different questions that you may ask me. In this demo, I am able to answer around 20 different questions about the IBM Voice Gateway, such as use-cases, price, documentation, security, running environment, capacity, contacts, etc ...
I'm sorry, I do not understand your question. My responses are limited to questions about the IBM Voice Gateway ...
Sorry, I wasn't able to get your question or there was a period of silence ...

The voice gateway is a new solution that allows you to connect the telephone network to various Watson services in Bluemix. For the first release we have built in functionality to support two main use cases - would you like me to go into more detail about the use cases?

The voice gateway is a new solution that allows you to connect to various Watson services in Bluemix using the existing telephone network. For instance, you or your customer can access Watson artificial intelligence capabilities via a cell phone. In the first release we have built in functionality to support two main user scenarios - would you like me to go into more detail about the use cases?
... Hello ... this is Watson. Say English to continue in English ... Say Spanish to continue in Spanish ... or say Portuguese to continue in Portuguese ...
... Hello ... this is Watson. Say English to continue in English ... Spanish to continue in Spanish ... or Portuguese to continue in Portuguese ...
... Hello ... this is Watson. You may choose the language we will use to communicate. Say English ... Spanish ... or Portuguese ...
